title: access to google maps
content: When i browse for anything that has some location, like a restaurant, city, or whatever, there is seemingly no way to access google maps for that site from the page. There used to be mutliple ways to go to google maps for that thing either by a "map" text button in the menu under the search bar, or by clicking the thumbnail of tha map you can see in the right of my example. now i have to go specifically search for maps, then search again for the thing there. Why did you make these changes? and will you ever revert/find a solution for this? Its actually such an annoyance for me as much of the searching i do is for looking up places. and related information about those places. If i am missing some functionality or alternative please let me know.
creator: edwardgilbert29

title: PC crashes sometimes after finishing a chess game in Firefox
content:
For the past few weeks, my PC reliably crashed after a few chess games on chess.com with Firefox. GPU and Memory benchmarks are running through without issues, it did crash when starting a Steam game once before, but I wasn't able to find out why. At this point, I'm really curious to learn about what could possibly cause this, but don't really know where to look for it. Really wondering what special thing is happening after a game there that doesn't happen with other websites/browsers. Would really appreciate your help!

Running Wayland on Archlinux 6.15.7 with AM5 CPU and DDR5 memory. Sometimes wondering if it's a graphics issue since my display is connected via the iGPU, but I also have an NVIDIA graphics card installed that I use for games sometimes.
creator: randufresne

title: Text in header <th> cells not visible (plus other font issues)
content:
Myself and a colleague who both use Firefox on Mac are experiencing the exact same issues.

1. Table header cells don't show their text, unless we specify a font for the table

I tried to put an example of the HTML here but it was rendered as a table by this page. I'll add some images of the code instead to show it.

In Firefox the Header cells are not visible, but in Chrome the text appears correctly.

If we add CSS like...

<style> table { font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; } </style>

...in the header then the missing text in the THs appears.


2. Other font issues

The Wave accessibility extension has text that doesn't appear and throw errors like this in the console...

downloadable font: rejected by sanitizer (font-family: "Open Sans" style:normal weight:400 stretch:100 src index:3) source: moz-extension://b86260c9-33f6-4529-b12f-a101d8607bd4/styles/open-sans-v17-latin-regular.woff

These only occur on Firefox on our Macs. Fine on PC and other browsers on the Macs.

We tried a whole series of tweaks to settings to try fix this.


I have tried resetting Firefox and doing a fresh install but nothing fixes either issue. Are these known issues with recent Firefox releases on Mac?
creator: darrenj1

title: Screenshot tool ignores custom save location and defaults to Downloads
content:
I'm using Firefox on macOS, and I'm having a persistent issue with the built-in screenshot tool. 

   When I take a screenshot using the right-click → "Take Screenshot" option, Firefox always saves the image to the Downloads folder, even though I’ve changed the setting in about:config to use a different save location. 
   I've tried modifying: 
       browser.download.dir to a custom folder 
       browser.download.useDownloadDir → true or false (I've tested both) 
   Despite these changes, Firefox continues to ignore the custom path and always saves screenshots in the default Downloads folder. 
   I’d like to know: 
       Is this a known issue? 
       Is there a working method to change the default save folder for screenshots? 
       Or is the screenshot tool hardcoded to use Downloads regardless of configuration?

Thanks in advance for your help.
creator: ethicalliving41

title: I lost all my data to my account and I don't know what to do to fix it.
content:
I was trying to revert to an older version of Firefox. It asked me to create a new account to avoid data problems and junk. I clicked that, something went wrong, I ended up logging into my original account, and now all my bookmarks, add-ons, history, everything is gone, and there's nothing to sync anymore for some reason, even though it was working before. And the older Firefox I downloaded automatically updated to the newer version, so it was pointless. What do I do? Please help.

Edit: Nevermind, I figured it out. I was using the wrong Firefox profile for my account.
creator: jordan.cummings42

title: Windows 11 update KB5062660 causes Firefox browser to crash immediately after startup
content:
Windows 11 update KB5062660 causes Firefox browser to crash immediately after startup 设备名称 702-wenjian 处理器 11th Gen Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-11400 @ 2.60GHz 2.59 GHz 机带 RAM 16.0 GB (15.7 GB 可用) 设备 ID 1FE25F14-B045-48BB-BA31-A842A8B33888 产品 ID 00330-80000-00000-AA679 系统类型 64 位操作系统, 基于 x64 的处理器 笔和触控 没有可用于此显示器的笔或触控输入

2025.07.23 I have installed the update. https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/july-22-2025-kb5062660-os-build-26100-4770-preview-9c5bc200-52b6-4c1a-be70-80df6bbfe9c3 Then the browser cannot start. It manifests as the browser freezing within 3 seconds after startup, showing no response, and then having to choose to exit. I tried to downgrade version 137.0.2, but the problem still persists. After uninstalling this update, the problem was resolved.

title: All Bookmarks have disappeared & Toolbar has disappeared. Also unable to "save" any new bookmarks"
content:
I turned off my Windows 11 PC a few hours ago. Prior to turning the PC off,all was working very well as it has done since inception 12 months ago. When I turned PC a bout an hour ago, I have noticed that all my bookmarks have disappeared as well as my Toolbar and all items that were on the Toolbar. In addition attempts to "save" new bookmarks are fruitless. I did a "refresh" on Firefox but there was no improvement. Latest version of Firefox was automatically uploaded by Firefox last night - whether that has caused the upset I do not know.

Additionally - when PC was operating properly prior to being turned off today, I was able to use "Snipping" tool which I can no longer use.

I really need help please. Ron
